page.title: 10LAUGHTON PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Laughton County Primary School was completed in 1872. It now has 79 pupils in three classes. Teaching in the top class is shared by the headmaster and a part-time teacher. Children attending come from Laughton, Ripe, Chalvington, Ringmer, Selmeston and Glynde. All the children stay at lunch time: some bring sandwiches, about half eat school dinners, which are cooked in the school's kitchen. Every day the postman calls (even if we have no mail) because the cook always has a cup of tea ready! The school has its own swimming pool, good playground space and uses the adjoining recreation ground. A video recorder has just been delivered and shortly we will have a photocopier and a disk drive. The old school house was converted this year into an office, with extra teaching and storage space.
